summary.para: Called when the sample-grabber sink receives a new media sample.

param.name: guidMajorMediaType
param.para: The major type that specifies the format of the data. For a list of possible values, see Major Media Types.

param.name: llSampleTime
param.para: The presentation time for this sample, in 100-nanosecond units. If the sample does not have a presentation time, the value of this parameter is _I64_MAX.

param.name: llSampleDuration
param.para: The duration of the sample, in 100-nanosecond units. If the sample does not have a duration, the value of this parameter is _I64_MAX.

param.name: pSampleBuffer
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that contains the sample data.

param.name: dwSampleSize
param.para: Size of the pSampleBuffer buffer, in bytes.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If you use the sample-grabber sink in a playback topology, this method should return quickly, or it might interfere with playback. Do not block the thread, wait on events, or perform other lengthy operations inside this method.

summary.para: Called when the presentation clock is set on the sample-grabber sink.

param.name: pPresentationClock
param.para: Pointer to the presentation clock's interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This method should return quickly, or it might interfere with playback. Do not block the thread, wait on events, or perform other lengthy operations inside this method.

summary.para: Called when the sample-grabber sink is shut down.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This method is called when the sink's method is called.
The OnShutdown method should return quickly, or it might interfere with playback. Do not block the thread, wait on events, or perform other lengthy operations inside this method.

summary.para: Callback interface to get media data from the sample-grabber sink.

remarks.para: The sample-grabber sink enables an application to get data from the Media Foundation pipeline without implementing a custom media sink. To use the sample-grabber sink, the application must perform the following steps:

description.para: Call , passing in the IMFSampleGrabberSinkCallback interface pointer. This function returns an object.
Create a topology that includes an output node with the sink's object.
Pass this topology to the Media Session.

remarks.para: During playback, the sample-grabber sink calls methods on the application's callback.
You cannot use the sample-grabber sink to get protected content.
